Package org.radarbase.management.web.rest

Class UserResource

java.lang.Object
org.radarbase.management.web.rest.UserResource
@RestController @RequestMapping("/api") public class UserResource extends Object
REST controller for managing users.

This class accesses the User entity, and needs to fetch its collection of authorities.

For a normal use-case, it would be better to have an eager relationship between User and Authority, and send everything to the client side: there would be no View Model and DTO, a lot less code, and an outer-join which would be good for performance.

We use a View Model and a DTO for 3 reasons:

  • We want to keep a lazy association between the user and the authorities, because people will quite often do relationships with the user, and we don't want them to get the authorities all the time for nothing (for performance reasons). This is the #1 goal: we should not impact our users' application because of this use-case.
  • Not having an outer join causes n+1 requests to the database. This is not a real issue as we have by default a second-level cache. This means on the first HTTP call we do the n+1 requests, but then all authorities come from the cache, so in fact it's much better than doing an outer join (which will get lots of data from the database, for each HTTP call).
  • As this manages users, for security reasons, we'd rather have a DTO layer.

Another option would be to have a specific JPA entity graph to handle this case.

  • Method Details

    • createUser

      @PostMapping("/users") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<User> createUser(@RequestBody ManagedUserVM managedUserVm) throws URISyntaxException, org.radarbase.auth.exception.NotAuthorizedException
      POST /users : Creates a new user.

      Creates a new user if the login and email are not already used, and sends an mail with an activation link. The user needs to be activated on creation.

      Parameters:
      managedUserVm - the user to create
      Returns:
      the ResponseEntity with status 201 (Created) and with body the new user, or with status 400 (Bad Request) if the login or email is already in use
      Throws:
      URISyntaxException - if the Location URI syntax is incorrect
      org.radarbase.auth.exception.NotAuthorizedException

    • updateUser

      @PutMapping("/users") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<UserDTO> updateUser(@RequestBody ManagedUserVM managedUserVm) throws org.radarbase.auth.exception.NotAuthorizedException
      PUT /users : Updates an existing User.
      Parameters:
      managedUserVm - the user to update
      Returns:
      the ResponseEntity with status 200 (OK) and with body the updated user, or with status 400 (Bad Request) if the login or email is already in use, or with status 500 (Internal Server Error) if the user couldn't be updated
      Throws:
      org.radarbase.auth.exception.NotAuthorizedException

    • getUsers

      @GetMapping("/users") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<List<UserDTO>> getUsers(@PageableDefault(page=0,size=2147483647) org.springframework.data.domain.Pageable pageable, UserFilter userFilter, @RequestParam(defaultValue="true") boolean includeProvenance) throws org.radarbase.auth.exception.NotAuthorizedException
      GET /users : get all users.
      Parameters:
      pageable - the pagination information
      userFilter - filter parameters as follows. projectName Optional, if specified return only users associated this project authority Optional, if specified return only users that have this authority login Optional, if specified return only users that have this login email Optional, if specified return only users that have this email
      Returns:
      the ResponseEntity with status 200 (OK) and with body all users
      Throws:
      org.radarbase.auth.exception.NotAuthorizedException

    • getUser

      @GetMapping("/users/{login:^[_\'.@A-Za-z0-9- ]*$}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<UserDTO> getUser(@PathVariable String login) throws org.radarbase.auth.exception.NotAuthorizedException
      GET /users/:login : get the "login" user.
      Parameters:
      login - the login of the user to find
      Returns:
      the ResponseEntity with status 200 (OK) and with body the "login" user, or with status 404 (Not Found)
      Throws:
      org.radarbase.auth.exception.NotAuthorizedException

    • deleteUser

      @DeleteMapping("/users/{login:^[_\'.@A-Za-z0-9- ]*$}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Void> deleteUser(@PathVariable String login) throws org.radarbase.auth.exception.NotAuthorizedException
      DELETE /users/:login : delete the "login" User.
      Parameters:

      Returns:
      the ResponseEntity with status 200 (OK)
